sentree.com-site.title: Sentree.com
sentree.com-site.caption: I built this site for the Sentree device using their required Wordpress X-Theme.

menuapp-settings-form-ui.title: Menu app settings form UI
menuapp-settings-form-ui.caption: Applying styles to match the final published site UI

downloadcard-carrier-mockups.title: MRetail shelf hangers
downloadcard-carrier-mockups.caption: Mockups for retail shelf hangers for The DownloadCard

small-screen-navigation-pattern.title: Alternating mobile nav pattern
small-screen-navigation-pattern.caption: Menu and search are triggered from either the left or right side of title

media-ecommerce-ui-library.title: Media UI Library
media-ecommerce-ui-library.caption: A media e-commerce UI Library we built for Choose Digital’s loyalty/incentive digital media store

cd-logo-treatments.title: Choose Digital logo scratch
cd-logo-treatments.caption: Sketch treatments for Choose Digital logo

downloadcard-logo-treatments.title: The DownloadCard logo
downloadcard-logo-treatments.caption: Several treatments for The DownloadCard logo

media-icons.title: Five Media Icons
media-icons.caption: Icon set for digital media formats: music, movies, TV, eBooks, and audiobooks.

mileageplus-microsite.title: MileagePlus microsite
mileageplus-microsite.caption: Web design for a microsite for MileagePlus Digital Media Store

choose-digital-apps.title: Choose Digital Apps
choose-digital-apps.caption: As a minimally-funded startup, Choose Digital was a great opportunity for me to build up all kids of skills: product concept and building, UX and wireframing, front end coding, pattern library, UI writing, etc.

viggle-store-webapp.title: Viggle Store Web App
viggle-store-webapp.caption: Viggle Store was a digital media store for music, e-books, audiobooks, movies, and TV, and the app supported both the web environment and native webviews

choose-digital-website.title: ChooseDigital.com
choose-digital-website.caption: The goal for ChooseDigital.com I set out to create: present the company as experts in digital media, awards incentives, and the company’s services as easily integrated into large enterprise portal-style marketplace sies yet with a modern aesthetic. Easy, right?

prologic-website.title: ProLogic Systems
prologic-website.caption: Prologic wanted a fast, straightforward brochure-style site that would appeal to large, traditional corporate IT departments. Make it blue!

rewards-network-website.title: Rewards Network microsite
rewards-network-website.caption: I presented visual ideas to the client intentionally in contrast to what was their usual style of tiny stock images and heavy blocks of text. A lot of text editing iterations simplified the message and allowed the design to breathe.

international-paper.title: International Paper
international-paper.caption: This was a very fast little project that I got to do for International Paper as an explainer for their sustainability message. I was a bit intimidated to be working for such a large company, not knowing what their expectations were and working completely without branding guidelines.

smallwoods-catalog.title: Smallwood’s Catalog
smallwoods-catalog.caption: A series of printed catalogs I art directed and designed, and for which I oversaw press production. Smallwoods is a boutique store that outfits staff and officers throughout the ship and yacht industries.

isp-logos.title: Logo for ISP
isp-logos.caption: Logo design and corporate collateral for International Shipping Partners (ISP). I suggested a simple bold shape to differentiate their logo as much as possible from competitors, and to ensure that it worked well when faxed. What I learned more than anything was how to pitch design ideas to a meeting full of people to which the process of design was completely foreign.
